features: 🌿 WHY PYUNKANG YUL? - Along with know-how recipe of Pyunkang Yul Eastern Medicine Clinic, specialized in treating skin and respiratory diseases for about 50 years, the toner helps to calm angry skin comfortably by carefully selected ingredients found in nature.

🌿 STRONG MOISTURIZING: Panthenol and 5 Hyaluronic Acid attract moisture up to 1000 times its weight, provides a deep hydrating feeling by quickly supplying moisture to dry skin. A mimute particle of Squalane does not close pores, gives strong moisurizing power to skin and rich vitamin and nutrition included in Shea Butter vitalizes skin.

🌿 SUITABLE FOR SENSITIVE SKIN TYPES: Through Centella Asiatica extract, Tea Tree extract and Lonicera Japonica Flower Extract, known as a representative soothing ingredient, that quickly calms angry skin in a healthy way and controls excess sebum also moisturizes delicate skin.
🌿 RICH AND FRESH TEXTURE : The cream has rich and refreshing texture, providing a perfect absorbing to the deep inside of skin without being greasy.
🌿 USEFUL TIP: After using toner, gently apply the cream on the surface of skin. For a much deeper nutrition, you can finish by gently pressing your face with your palms.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on June 27, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Great lightweight moisturizer!
reviews.reviewText: Super light & airy texture, and spreads like a dream! I have very sensitive, dry/combo skin that is prone to inflammation and clogged pores. I usually break out whenever I try something new, but this is one of the few products that didn't cause any adverse reaction. My cheeks didn't flare up either, which is more than I can say for most of the moisturizers I've tried in the past. Although the texture is really light (reminds me of a water cream), it's still moisturizing enough for my skin that I don't feel like I need to reapply during the spring/summer months (though I'll probably need something more substantial when it eventually gets colder). I will say that I do wish it came in a larger size; my first jar lasted about two and a half months with daily use, while my current jar will probably last me about 3 months. It's so inexpensive though compared to my previous moisturizers so I don't mind it that much.For those on the fence between this and the repair balm, I purchased both because I loved the barrier cream so much and found that the balm is much thicker and probably more suited to those with dry/very dry skin. It also has more of a matte finish which makes my skin appear almost dull compared to the subtle dewiness of this barrier cream (while the dewiness does eventually fade to a natural finish, almost like I didn't put anything on, the repair balm makes my skin look visibly matte). While the repair balm feels too heavy for me, it didn't make me break out or cause any inflammation (and I did like layering it over the barrier cream during the winter when I needed a bit more moisture in my drier spots). Another thing to note is that the repair balm jar is much smaller than the barrier cream (probably about half the size) but because I need so little of it due to the thicker texture, I think it would probably last me about the same amount of time with daily use (maybe about three months, twice that if I only used a bit of it where needed). Overall I think they're both really good moisturizers, especially for the price, but I much prefer the texture, dewiness, and lightweight nature of the barrier cream. Hope this helps! (also my previous review was deleted for some reason so I'm writing this again lol hopefully it stays up this time).Update (2/13/2024): Just wanted to do a quick update. I temporarily stopped using this cream back in October last year because I needed something a little heavier for the dry weather. I switched to the nourishing cream from this same brand, and it's been perfect. It's thicker than the barrier cream but not nearly as heavy as the repair balm. The texture is creamier than the repair balm and has a very natural finish. It definitely feels heavier than the barrier cream but it's still lightweight and keeps my skin moisturized until I wash it off (maybe avoid the nourishing cream if you have quite oily skin though). No irritation whatsoever either. I will be going back to the barrier cream once the weather starts warming up though (still in love with the airy, cloud-like texture).

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 26, 2024
reviews.reviewText: Very thick, hydrating moisturizer that feels like a face mask. Keeps my skin moisturized all day.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on February 1, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 4.0 out of 5 stars A very light moisturizer
reviews.reviewText: I’ve been using this product for 2 1/2 weeks and it’s great! I pair it with the PYUNKANG YUL Low pH Pore Deep Cleansing Foam and the pyunkang yul essence toner. This is a very very light moisturizer. If you have very dry skin, THIS IS NOT FOR YOU. I only use this moisturizer in the morning. At night I use the creave moisturizing lotion. It is too light to sleep in. It almost feels too light during the day but it works very well. I feel nothing on my face. This is not a greasy moisturizer. There is no smell. This would be a perfect daytime moisturizer for the summer time. It’s great for winter, but only for normal to oily skin I would say. The only reason I’m giving it 4 stars is because it wouldn’t work for all skin types and I hate tub containers like these. I have acrylic nails so it’s hard to get out. But besides that, the product itself is very good. I would recommend!

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 27, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Lightweight but very moisturizing
reviews.reviewText: I’m on my 3rd jar of this, love it so much. I have sensitive skin and mild rosacea, so I can’t use extra heavy creams on my face. I love this because it feels very light, completely sinks in, and you can amp up the moisture by applying more without it feeling too occlusive. Great product at a reasonable price.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on July 20, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Best Skincare Find of Recent Years
reviews.reviewText: This cream feels like applying cooling cucumber water, aloe and shea butter to the skin. It's so soothing, and it's like that each time I use it. It absorbs well and it does not just sit on the skin, have any type of silicone feeling (which even some silicone-free products manage to have), or cause any hint of irritation. Perfect texture, with beautiful results. I'm very impressed with the science and medicine behind the Pyunkang Yul brand. I use this product after applying Benton's Propolis & Snail essence or Cosrx's Snail essence, and use a thicker cream if there are any areas I feel need it, but honestly, my desert island picks would be the Pyukang Yul and Benton duo because they can achieve so, so much.I just bought 2 of the new Cosrx creams for 3-4x the price of this product, and neither is as good, so I need to stop trying to fix what's working.This is fantastic for dehydrated skin and very sensitive-skin friendly, and for those looking for a fragrance-free option. For dry skin, the balm version is probably a better fit. It shouldn't lose stars for not being an occlusive moisturizer; this does something different and it does it really well. The only product I can compare it to is sold for more than 5x the cost of PY's for less than half the size and has to be purchased through that brand's site.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on December 23, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 3.0 out of 5 stars THIS IS A BASIC MOISTURIZER FOR ME
reviews.reviewText: Having tried some other K beauty moisturizers, I would say that this one was okay. It didn't wow me. There wasn't any difference to my skin. I like other moisturizers much better than this one. I will not be repurchasing.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on February 10, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Great lightweight moisturizer
reviews.reviewText: This is a great and affordable moisturizer for my sensitive skin. There is no scent and it is lightweight, which is great for the warmer weather where I live. It does not any irritation and is definitely soothing. The price is another plus as it comes with 1.69ml of product. I definitely recommend this and will continue to use it as my warm weather moisturizer.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on February 1, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Saved my skin
reviews.reviewText: I’m a wife writing this review on my husbands account. I just had a baby not long ago and my skin has been drier than the Sahara desert for months. Nothing I was trying worked until THIS. my skin has never felt softer. It doesn’t have a smell. It doesn’t leave a greasy feeling. I put it on my face in the morning and night. And sometimes in the middle of the day. I love this product so much. Will be buying again

reviews.reviewTitle: Amazing moisturizer which doesn't burn your eyes!
reviews.reviewText: PYUNKANG YUL Calming Moisture Barrier Cream has completely won me over with its exceptional performance and soothing benefits. As someone with sensitive and reactive skin, finding the perfect moisturizer has always been a challenge, but this cream has exceeded all my expectations.The first thing I noticed was the luxurious texture of the cream. It's rich and nourishing without feeling heavy or greasy on the skin. The formula absorbs beautifully, leaving my skin instantly hydrated and supple. I appreciate that a little goes a long way, making this product not only effective but also economical.The star feature of this moisturizer is its calming effect on the skin. The unique blend of ingredients, including the signature "Moisture Biome," works wonders in reducing redness and irritation. After incorporating this cream into my skincare routine, I noticed a significant improvement in the overall tone and texture of my skin. It has become my go-to solution for combating sensitivity and maintaining a calm complexion.What sets PYUNKANG YUL apart is its commitment to simplicity and purity. The cream is fragrance-free and devoid of unnecessary additives, making it ideal for those with sensitivities or allergies. I appreciate the brand's dedication to clean and minimalistic formulations that prioritize skin health.The Moisture Barrier Cream has become a crucial step in my daily skincare routine, especially during harsh weather conditions. It creates a protective layer that shields my skin from environmental stressors, helping to maintain a healthy moisture balance throughout the day.In summary, PYUNKANG YUL Calming Moisture Barrier Cream is a skincare gem. Its calming properties, lightweight yet deeply moisturizing texture, and commitment to clean beauty make it a five-star product in my skincare arsenal. If you're in search of a reliable moisturizer that caters to sensitive skin, look no further – this cream delivers on its promises and more.

Best moisturizer ever. Moisturizes without leaving you with the feeling of heaviness on your skin. Reduced ( in my case) the appearance of fine lines. Acts as a great primer to foundation or gel/ cream blush. Soothes my skin after treatments with actives/ peel.great product.
